courses.aims:
Students completing the BSc (Hons) in Computer Science will
  • Acquire a general knowledge and understanding of computers and computer science
  • Develop a more specialised knowledge of the theoretical foundation of computer science and other selected topics within the discipline
  • Encounter and work with a variety of approaches, techniques and tools in order to solve the different types of problem encountered in the discipline
  • Acquire the ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing both under pressure and reflectively
  • Understand the professional, legal and ethical aspects of the discipline and know how to act on these appropriately.

o.title: Fuzzy Sets and Fuzzy Logic Systems

courses.title: Bachelor of Science with Honours Computer Science

courses.aims:
You will graduate with
  • an understanding of computers and computer science;
  • knowledge of the theoretical foundations of computer science and other selected topics within the discipline;
  • experience in a variety of techniques needed to solve problems encountered in the discipline;
  • and an understanding of the professional, legal, and ethical aspects of the discipline.

o.title: Fuzzy Sets and Fuzzy Logic Systems
Methods for Understanding Users in Computer Science

courses.title: Master in Science with Honours Computer Science

courses.aims:
Students completing the BSc (Hons) in Computer Science with Artificial Intelligence will:
  • Acquire a general knowledge and understanding of computers and computer science
  • Develop a more specialised knowledge of theoretical and practical aspects of artificial intelligence
  • Encounter and work with a variety of approaches, techniques and tools in order to solve the different types of problem encountered in computer science in general and artificial intelligence in particular
  • Acquire the ability to communicate effectively orally, and in writing, both under pressure and reflectively
  • Understand the professional, legal, and ethical aspects of the discipline and know how to act on these appropriately

o.title: Fuzzy Sets and Fuzzy Logic Systems

courses.title: Bachelor of Science with Honours Computer Science with Artificial Intelligence

courses.aims:
You will graduate with
  • an understanding of computers, computer science and artificial intelligence;
  • knowledge of the theoretical foundations of computer science;
  • knowledge of the theory, techniques, and applications of artificial intelligence;
  • experience in a variety of techniques needed to solve problems encountered in computer science in general and artificial intelligence in particular; and
  • an understanding of the professional, legal, and ethical aspects of the discipline.

o.title: Fuzzy Sets and Fuzzy Logic Systems
Methods for Understanding Users in Computer Science

courses.title: Master in Science with Honours Computer Science with Artificial Intelligence

courses.aims:
Students completing the BSc (Hons) in Software Engineering will:
  • Acquire a general knowledge and understanding of computers and software engineering
  • Develop more specialised knowledge of the design, implementation, user interfaces, and evaluation of software engineering
  • Encounter and work with a variety of tools and methodologies in order to solve a variety of problems encountered in the area of software engineering
  • Develop the ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing in a variety of situations

o.title: Fuzzy Sets and Fuzzy Logic Systems

courses.title: Bachelor of Science with Honours Software Engineering

courses.aims:
Students completing the BSc (Hons) in Computer Science and Management Studies will
  • Acquire a general knowledge and understanding of computers, computer science and management studies
  • Develop a more specialised knowledge of selected topics within the disciplines, with particular focus on the management of information and other resources.
  • Encounter and work with a variety of approaches, techniques and tools in order to solve the different types of problem encountered in the disciplines.
  • Acquire the ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing both under pressure and reflectively
  • Understand the professional, legal and ethical aspects of the discipline and know how to act on these appropriately.
  • Gain an understanding of organisations, their management and the changing external environment in which they operate.

o.title: Introduction to Management Science for Business Decisions
Fuzzy Sets and Fuzzy Logic Systems
Origins and Development of the UK Economy
East Asian Business in the Twentieth Century
East Asian Business in the Global Economy

courses.title: Bachelor of Science with Joint Honours Computer Science and Management Studies

courses.aims:
The underlying aim of the programme is to offer students a broad and challenging modern curriculum which will enable them to gain a deep understanding of mathematics and computer science. The programme will provide students with specific knowledge for its own sake, but also, acknowledging the wide and growing variety of uses to which mathematics and computer science are applied, techniques and skills suitable for a wide range of careers. The specific aims of the programme are:
  • To provide students with a broad knowledge of mathematics and computer science and to develop their competence in these areas.
  • To provide students with opportunities to develop a more specialised knowledge of selected topics in mathematics and computer science.
  • To provide students with opportunities to encounter and work with a variety of approaches, techniques and tools to solve different problems within the two disciplines.
  • To enable students to develop their ability to think logically and critically, to acquire problem-solving skills and to communicate effectively orally and in writing.
  • As graduates of a mathematics programme, students will appreciate the power of abstraction and generalisation as mathematical processes and have an understanding of the importance of assumptions, the limitations these impose on what can be deduced and the consequences of their not being satisfied.
  • As graduates of a computer science programme, students will understand the professional and ethical aspects of the discipline and know how to act on these appropriately.
courses.title: Bachelor of Science with Joint Honours Mathematics and Computer Science
